message_1: Solve for the absolute value of x in the equation: |3x - 7| = 10
message_2:
To solve for the absolute value of x in the equation |3x - 7| = 10, we need to consider two cases:

Case 1: 3x - 7 = 10
3x = 17
x = 17/3

Case 2: -(3x - 7) = 10
3x - 7 = -10
3x = -3
x = -1

So, the two possible values for x are 17/3 and -1.
